page.title: 15EDUCATION - COUSLAND SCHOOL
page.content: THE PRESENT SCHOOL, BUILT IN 1966-67, REPLACED THE 100 YEAR OLD SCHOOL AND SCHOOL HOUSE, WHICH IS NOW THE HOME AND STUDIO OF A LOCAL ARTIST. THE SCHOOL HAS TWO CLASSROOMS, AND ASSEMBLY/PE HALL, A DINING AREA/STAGE, A WORKING KITCHEN, CLOAKROOMS AND STAFF ACCOMODATION. IT IS SURROUNDED BY A LARGE PLAYGROUND OF GRASS AND CONCRETE. THE 37 PUPILS COME FROM THE VILLAGE OF COUSLAND AND SURROUNDING FARMS, COTTAGES AND LODGE HOUSES. 40% OF THE PUPILS COME BY SCHOOL BUS. TWO FULL TIME STAFF ARE ASSISTED BY THE HEAD TEACHER'S RELIEF TEACHER, VISITING TEACHERS IN CRAFT, MUSIC, P.E. AND BRASS INSTRUCTION, AND THE SCHOOL AUXILIARY/CLERKESS. THE PUPILS STUDY LANGUAGE, MATHEMATICS, ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES, EXPRESSIVE ARTS, RELIGION AND P.E.
